title: World Cup qualifying latest, Irish hopes boosted and Ronaldo fumes: football news – live
summary: Join our writers for in-depth coverage and analysis leading up to the latest World Cup qualifiers. Stay updated on the buildup to the matches and the reactions that follow. Get insights into the teams and players as they vie for a spot in the tournament.

title: Zelenskyy condemns Russia’s ‘wicked’ overnight attack on Ukraine – Europe live
summary: Kyiv was targeted by drones and missiles, resulting in the deaths of at least four individuals and injuring dozens more. The attacks have raised concerns about ongoing security in the region. Authorities continue to assess the situation and provide assistance to those affected.

title: Reeves accused of ‘rattling the markets’ after income tax U-turn pushes up borrowing costs – UK politics live
summary: The Chancellor has reportedly abandoned plans to break the manifesto pledge on income tax, according to a source cited by the Guardian. This decision reflects a potential shift in fiscal strategy. The move aims to maintain public trust and align with prior commitments.

title: Mahmood to unveil changes to tackle illegal migration modelled on Danish system
summary: The Home Secretary will announce new measures aimed at discouraging migrants from entering the UK. The plans include streamlining the deportation process to make it easier to remove individuals without legal status. This initiative is part of the government's broader efforts to manage immigration and control borders effectively.

title: Pound and UK bonds slide as Reeves ditches plans for income tax hike – business live
summary: Concerns are increasing regarding the UK's upcoming autumn budget as Chancellor Rachel Reeves has decided not to proceed with plans to raise income tax. This announcement, made on November 26, has led to heightened anxieties about the government's fiscal strategy. The decision reflects the challenges the government faces in balancing economic growth with public finances.
